alert.note: Alert for North Cass; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 4:43PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Itasca and northeastern Cass Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Deer River, to 6 miles southwest of Ball Club, to near Federal Dam, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Storm spotters reported dime to nickel size hail in Federal Dam at 435 PM. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Deer River and Zemple around 450 PM CDT. Grand Rapids, Days High Landing and Pokegama Dam around 515 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bass Lake, Ball Club Lake, Schoolcraft State Park, Mud Lake, Goose Lake, Bovey and La Prairie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. These storms may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
